task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then grasp the spatula tool and use it to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene features a pot with a lid, a separate plate, a spatula-like tool, and other utensils. The robot must first open the pot by removing its lid. Next, it should grasp the pot and place it centered on the nearby plate. Finally, it needs to acquire the spatula tool and use it to push the pot toward the front side of the table, improving its accessibility. Motions should be deliberate with standard timeouts and minimal placement force.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula present on the table
Workspace clear enough to move the arm
stepwise_plan: Perceive the pot and remove its lid using an open-container primitive.
Re-perceive the pot and compute a side grasp; pick the pot.
Place the pot onto the plate and release; retreat.
Perceive and grasp the spatula tool.
Push the pot toward the table front using the spatula; set it down; open gripper and retreat.
success_criteria: Pot is resting on the plate
Pot has been pushed toward the front edge relative to its prior position
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails, retry detection of the relevant target
If grasp fails, recompute grasp and retry
If push slips, re-approach and execute another push of the remaining distance
task_long_description.termination: End when the push completes and the tool is released with the arm safely retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: First stable grasping interaction on the pot/lid region is visible, marking transition from perception to manipulation.
frame_3.predicts_next: Placement on the plate is imminent; confirms alignment and grasp feasibility.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Plan a side grasp on the pot.
Execute the grasp on the pot.
Back away from the placed pot.
Plan a top grasp on the tool.
Push the pot toward the front edge.
Place the tool down on the table.
Final retreat to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Push does not move pot sufficiently
assumptions: The contact sheet shows the lid removal, pot relocation to the plate, and later interaction with a spatula for pushing; push direction assumed toward the camera/front (180Â°).

expected_success_criteria: Pot noticeably closer to front edge after push
